answers.answer: Your post is pretty vague.1.) He is not overweightWhat is it? How tall?2.) eats pretty good selection of foodsHow does he watch his sugar intake? For example; Deserts? Milk?3.) Doctor says it is not the medicationExperiencing his nausea before or after Metformin? How much is he taking?4.) What is his fasting glucose levels when he awakes?As you can see, the quality of response is proportional to the quality of the question. Post back with answers so that I and/or others can help you.

question: My husband, 72yrs old, was just told he has diabetes and put on Gluaphough?  He is not overweight, and eats pretty good selection of foods.  But he has nausea all the time. Sometimes real bad. It just comes and goes. Eating or not eating does not effect it. Doctor says it is not the medication. Does anyone else have this too?  He gets up in the morning feeling likeh----, EVERYDAY. Please  suggest.
title: sick to stomach
